metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4245 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in codehaus-plexus. The org.codehaus.plexus.util.xml.XmlWriterUtil#writeComment fails to sanitize comments for a --> sequence. This issue means that text contained in the command string could be interpreted as XML and allow for XML injection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4245` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplexus-utils2-java - 3.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: plexus-utils2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.0-1').
